00029 #include <stdlib.h>
00030 #include <new>
00031 
00032 namespace bm
00033 {
00034 
00035 
00036 /*! @defgroup alloc Memory Allocation
00037  *  Memory allocation related units
00038  *  @ingroup bmagic
00039  *
00040  *  @{
00041  */
00042 
00043 /*! 
00044   @brief Default malloc based bitblock allocator class.
00045 
00046   Functions allocate and deallocate conform to STL allocator specs.
00047   @ingroup alloc
00048 */
00049 class block_allocator
00050 {
00051 public:
00052     /**
00053     The member function allocates storage for an array of n bm::word_t 
00054     elements, by calling malloc. 
00055     @return pointer to the allocated memory. 
00056     */
00057     static bm::word_t* allocate(size_t n, const void *)
00058     {
00059         bm::word_t* ptr;
00060 #if defined(BMSSE2OPT) || defined(BMSSE42OPT)
00061 # ifdef _MSC_VER
00062         ptr = (bm::word_t*) ::_aligned_malloc(n * sizeof(bm::word_t), 16);
00063 #else
00064         ptr = (bm::word_t*) ::_mm_malloc(n * sizeof(bm::word_t), 16);
00065 # endif
00066 
00067 #else  
00068         ptr = (bm::word_t*) ::malloc(n * sizeof(bm::word_t));
00069 #endif
00070         if (!ptr)
00071         {
00072             throw std::bad_alloc();
00073         }
00074         return ptr;
00075     }
00076 
00077     /**
00078     The member function frees storage for an array of n bm::word_t 
00079     elements, by calling free. 
00080     */
00081     static void deallocate(bm::word_t* p, size_t)
00082     {
00083 #if defined(BMSSE2OPT) || defined(BMSSE42OPT)
00084 # ifdef _MSC_VER
00085         ::_aligned_free(p);
00086 #else
00087         ::_mm_free(p);
00088 # endif
00089 
00090 #else  
00091         ::free(p);
00092 #endif
00093     }
00094 
00095 };
00096 
00097 
00098 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099 
00100 /*! @brief Default malloc based bitblock allocator class.
00101 
00102   Functions allocate and deallocate conform to STL allocator specs.
00103 */
00104 class ptr_allocator
00105 {
00106 public:
00107     /**
00108     The member function allocates storage for an array of n void* 
00109     elements, by calling malloc. 
00110     @return pointer to the allocated memory. 
00111     */
00112     static void* allocate(size_t n, const void *)
00113     {
00114         void* ptr = ::malloc(n * sizeof(void*));
00115         if (!ptr)
00116         {
00117             throw std::bad_alloc();
00118         }
00119         return ptr;
00120     }
00121 
00122     /**
00123     The member function frees storage for an array of n bm::word_t 
00124     elements, by calling free. 
00125     */
00126     static void deallocate(void* p, size_t)
00127     {
00128         ::free(p);
00129     }
00130 };
00131 
00132 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
00133 
00134 /*! @brief BM style allocator adapter. 
00135 
00136   Template takes two parameters BA - allocator object for bit blocks and
00137   PA - allocator object for pointer blocks.
00138 */
00139 template<class BA, class PA> class mem_alloc
00140 {
00141 public:
00142     typedef BA  block_allocator_type;
00143     typedef PA  ptr_allocator_type;
00144 
00145 public:
00146 
00147     mem_alloc(const BA& block_alloc = BA(), const PA& ptr_alloc = PA())
00148     : block_alloc_(block_alloc),
00149       ptr_alloc_(ptr_alloc)
00150     {}
00151     
00152     /*! @brief Returns copy of the block allocator object
00153     */
00154     block_allocator_type get_block_allocator() const 
00155     { 
00156         return BA(block_alloc_); 
00157     }
00158 
00159     /*! @brief Returns copy of the ptr allocator object
00160     */
00161     ptr_allocator_type get_ptr_allocator() const 
00162     { 
00163        return PA(block_alloc_); 
00164     }
00165 
00166 
00167     /*! @brief Allocates and returns bit block.
00168         @param alloc_factor 
00169             indicated how many blocks we want to allocate in chunk
00170             total allocation is going to be bm::set_block_size * alloc_factor
00171             Default allocation factor is 1
00172     */
00173     bm::word_t* alloc_bit_block(unsigned alloc_factor = 1)
00174     {
00175         return block_alloc_.allocate(bm::set_block_size * alloc_factor, 0);
00176     }
00177 
00178     /*! @brief Frees bit block allocated by alloc_bit_block.
00179     */
00180     void free_bit_block(bm::word_t* block, unsigned alloc_factor = 1)
00181     {
00182         if (IS_VALID_ADDR(block)) 
00183             block_alloc_.deallocate(block, bm::set_block_size * alloc_factor);
00184     }
00185 
00186     /*! @brief Allocates GAP block using bit block allocator (BA).
00187 
00188         GAP blocks in BM library belong to levels. Each level has a 
00189         correspondent length described in bm::gap_len_table<>.
00190         
00191         @param level GAP block level.
00192     */
00193     bm::gap_word_t* alloc_gap_block(unsigned level, 
00194                                     const gap_word_t* glevel_len)
00195     {
00196         BM_ASSERT(level < bm::gap_levels);
00197         unsigned len = 
00198             glevel_len[level] / (sizeof(bm::word_t) / sizeof(gap_word_t));
00199 
00200         return (bm::gap_word_t*)block_alloc_.allocate(len, 0);
00201     }
00202 
00203     /*! @brief Frees GAP block using bot block allocator (BA)
00204     */
00205     void free_gap_block(bm::gap_word_t*   block,
00206                         const gap_word_t* glevel_len)
00207     {
00208         BM_ASSERT(IS_VALID_ADDR((bm::word_t*)block));
00209          
00210         unsigned len = gap_capacity(block, glevel_len);
00211         len /= sizeof(bm::word_t) / sizeof(bm::gap_word_t);
00212         block_alloc_.deallocate((bm::word_t*)block, len);        
00213     }
00214 
00215     /*! @brief Allocates block of pointers.
00216     */
00217     void* alloc_ptr(unsigned size = bm::set_array_size)
00218     {
00219         return ptr_alloc_.allocate(size, 0);
00220     }
00221 
00222     /*! @brief Frees block of pointers.
00223     */
00224     void free_ptr(void* p, unsigned size = bm::set_array_size)
00225     {
00226         if (p)
00227             ptr_alloc_.deallocate(p, size);
00228     }
00229 private:
00230     BA            block_alloc_;
00231     PA            ptr_alloc_;
00232 };
00233 
00234 typedef mem_alloc<block_allocator, ptr_allocator> standard_allocator;
00235 
00236 /** @} */
00237

00239 } // namespace bm
